title: swash
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Swash**

**n.** Swash: A decorative, (and usually natural) extension of a [stroke](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/typophile.com/wiki/stroke) that one might perform in calligraphy.

**adj.** Swash: A term used to describe a [typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typeface) that is characterized by swashes.

**Additional Articles:**  
 [swsh](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/typophile.com/wiki/swsh)  
 [cswh](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/typophile.com/wiki/cswh)

**Links:**  
 [FYTI: Swash & Alternate Characters](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005627/http:/www.fonts.com/AboutFonts/Articles/fyti/SwashAlternateCharacters.htm)
author: paul d hunt
